intro: Pachycarpus fulvus, commonly known as the yellow holly, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth texture. Pachycarpus fulvus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
